data.title: Independent artists, writers, and performers
data.meta_description: The top three occupations in the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group are artists & related workers, writers & authors, and musicians and singers. On average, full-time employees in the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group work 44.8 hours per week and have an average annual salary of $78,494. Part-time employees in the same industry work 19.4 hours and earn an average annual salary of $28,293.
data.text:
As of February 2023, there are 20.1k people employed in the Independent Artists, Writers, and Performers industry. This represents a 11% increase in employment when compared to February 2022.

Independent artists, writers, and performers has a wage GINI of 0.584, which is more than than the national average of 0.478. In other words, wages are distributed less evenly in Independent artists, writers, and performers (shown in red) in comparison to the national average for those wage buckets (shown in gray).

The graph shows the distribution of employees in the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group according to occupations. In 2022, the occupations that concentrated the largest number of employees in this industry were artists & related workers (34,980 people), writers & authors (28,146 people), and musicians and singers (19,378 people)

On average, Male workers in the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group make 1.33 times more than their Female counterparts. This chart shows the sex-based wage disparity in the 5 most common occupations in the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group.

Professional and business services has the highest single input, by dollars, to the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group, and the largest industry purchasing services from the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group is Professional and business services.

In this flow diagram, all of the industries listed to the left are those places from which the highlighted industry has made purchases. They are the intermediate inputs to the highlighted industry. All those industries listed on the right side are those industries that have made purchases from the highlighted industry. They are the use of outputs of the highlighted industry. The visualizations below offer alternative ways to see and understand this data.

The Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group gets the most input, by its share of the cost of all intermediate inputs, from the Professional and business services Industry. This visualization does not include labor and capital costs.

The Professional and business services Industry purchases the greatest share of products and services from the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group in order to produce other goods and services. Purchases of the Independent artists, writers, and performers Industry Group for final consumption by consumers, businesses, or government are not included here.

In 2022, 74.6% of the workforce in the Independent artists, writers, and performers industry was White (117,976 people), of which 44.3% were women and 55.7% men.

This line chart shows the projected 10-year growth in the number of jobs for Independent Artists, Writers, and Performers. This industry is expected to grow approximately the same than 1.08%, the average rate of national job growth.
